Description: Papyrus fragment bearing a 9 line Coptic text written along the fibres (recto) and a 4 line Coptic text against the fibres (verso). 10454, 10127, 10460 are mounted together.
Curator's comments: Register says 'Found in some tombs in the hills behind Assiut'. Under study by Alain Delattre with a view to publication (updated March 2017). The text has been written by the same person as EA 10460 cf. S. Clackson, Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo, Oxford, 2000 p. 91, no. 28.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380624) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380624)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Dr Gulian Lansing
